intro: Hesperis kotschyi, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It features delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Hesperis kotschyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
